intro: Petrocoptis guarensis, commonly known as the Guarense rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, lobed leaves and small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
